adjectives.description: relatable (comparative more relatable, superlative most relatable)

entries.meaning: Able to be related to something else; connected with.
examples: The damage was relatable to the recent earthquake.

entries.meaning: Able to be related to on a personal level.
examples: The characters in the play are very warm and relatable.

entries.meaning: Able to be passed on verbally; capable of being narrated or suitable for relating.
examples: His verbal abuse was not relatable to polite ears.
